intro: Codonopsis hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy ginseng, is a flowering plant native to Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in forested areas and thrives in cool, moist climates. Its leaves are alternate and lance-shaped, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Codonopsis hirsuta is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal medicine.
